location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, Mount Aboo [Ābu] to Leslie Saunders, Commissioner at Ajmere [Ajmer]; Colonel William Beynon, Political Agent Jeypoor [Jaipur]; Colonel Alexander Hutchinson, Political Agent Oodeypoor [Udaipur]; Colonel William Carnell, Political Agent, Sirohie [Sirohi]; Captain Arthur Roberts, Political Agent Eastern States, Bhurtpoor [Bharatpur]; Captain James Berkeley, Officiating Political Agent Harotee [Hāroti]-Deolee [Deoli]; Captain Charles Burton, Assistant to the Agent Governor General, Bikaneer [Bīkāner]; Officiating Political Agent Marwar and Jeysulmere [Jaisalmer], Jodhpoor [Jodhpur]

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing a note from Captain Philip Durham Henderson concerning the forthcoming Durbar at Agra:Letter from Captain Philip Henderson, Simla to Colonel Lewis Pelly, Officiating Agent to the Governor General, Rajpootana [Rājasthān], 7 August 1873 informing Pelly that those Chief's who do not wish to attend, or cannot afford to do so should not be forced to and neither should those Chief's that His Excellency the Viceroy saw during his last tour. Also that retinues for those attending should be reduced as much as possible.
